title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.5-7 | 23-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञान तिमिरां धस्या ज्ञानां जनिशला कया चक्षुरुन मीलितं येना तस्वैं श्री गुरवे नमः
नमाओं विष्णु पाधाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदांत स्वामिन नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरबाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शून्यवादी पाश्चात्य देशतारिने
जाय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानंदा श्री अद्वाई तगदाधर श्रीवासादी गौरभक्त वृंदा
हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ण कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा रामा रामा हरे हरे
ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया नारायणम नमस कृत्या नरम जेवनर उत्तमम देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासम ततो जयम मुदीर येट
इन दिस सेशन विल बी डिस्कसिंग फ्राम वर्सेस फाइव सिक्स एंड सेवन आफ दि तर्टीन चैप्टर विद फर्स्ट कैंटर फ्रीमद भागवतम इस चैप्टर इस एंटाइटल रितराष्ट्रकविट्स होम
तो फिफ्ट वर्स प्रत्यु जग्म प्रहर्षेण प्राणम तन्म इवागतम अभिसंगम्य विदिवत परिश्वंगा अभिवादनईही
नियुक्त वर्स विदुरा अजय को लाइफ रिटर्न टू देर बॉडीज एक्सचेंज ऑबीसेंस एंड बेलकम इच अधर विद एमब्रेस इस
लगभाव पास इन रिपोर्ट इस एक कंटिनियेशन ओव प्रीवियस वर्स विद इसक्राइब्स विदुरा अराइव इन अस्तिनापुरा
एंड यू विस ग्रीटेड बाइस ओ मैनिंग दे रेसिडेंस ऑफ द पैलेस हेड़ेड बाइडी पांडवस
सॉव्यू फॉटिंग दे फील देख वर्डर बिंग डिस्क्राइड यू इन द एफर्सेंस ऑफ कांशियसनेस द लिम्स ओका बॉडी रेमेन इन अक्टिव बट
में कांशियसनेस रिटर्न ज़रूरे अ
the limbs and senses become active and existence itself becomes delightful
Vidura was so dear to the members of the Kaurava family
that his long absence from the palace was comparable to inactivity
why was Vidura absent for a long time from the palace
if you remember it was described previously
that Vidura was insulted by Duryodhana
when Vidura was trying to advise Dhritarashtra, his elder brother
in some particular issue
particularly Dhritarashtra not treating the Pandavas properly
while the Pandavas were actually
not treating the Pandavas properly
without their father
fatherless children
and Dhritarashtra was a caretaker
but he was not properly treating the Pandavas
he was partial to his own sons
and he did so much injustice to the Pandavas
and therefore when Vidura pointed that out to Dhritarashtra
Duryodhana became very angry and he insulted Vidura
of course Vidura apparently left the palace
being insulted by Duryodhana
but in reality Vidura left the palace
because he wanted to inquire about the spiritual subject matter
from saintly persons in the places of pilgrimage
therefore Vidura left the palace in order to visit holy place of pilgrimage
to search out for a saintly person
who could explain to him
the truth about this cell
Atma Vidya or Brahma Vidya
this is actually the real business of human form of life
to make this inquiry
in the Vedanta Sutra it is said
Athato Brahma Jignasa
so Vidura actually left the palace
not because he was insulted by Duryodhana
but really because he wanted to inquire
and acquire the knowledge about this cell
Atma Vidya
so Vidura left and went on a pilgrimage
and he kept travelling till he met Uddhava
in one of the holy places of pilgrimage
and he began to inquire from Uddhava
about this cell
while Uddhava began to speak
then Uddhava realized
that Vidura's questions can best be answered by Maitreya Rishi
because even though both Uddhava and Maitreya Rishi
were instructed by Krishna
before Krishna's departure from this world
at the end of his manifest pastimes
even though both were instructed
and both were self realized
both were competent
but Maitreya Rishi was elder in age to Uddhava
therefore Uddhava did not want
to actually do Maryada Vetikrama
he didn't want to break the Vaishnava etiquette
that when there is a senior devotee
or senior personality present
then the younger one should not instruct
the seekers of knowledge
spiritual knowledge
so Uddhava directed Vidura
to go to Maitreya Rishi
who was nearby
and inquire from Maitreya Rishi
about this knowledge of the cell
Atma Vidya
accordingly Vidura went to Maitreya Rishi
and Maitreya Rishi received Vidura very nicely
and instructed him
so after Vidura was instructed by Maitreya Rishi
then he came back to Hastinapura
why did he come back
to actually deliver his brother Dhritarashtra
by this time
already the battle of Kurukshetra was over
and all the Kauravas were killed in that battle
Dhritarashtra and Gandharva
were staying under the care of Yudhishthira
when Yudhishthira was enthroned as the emperor of the world
after the battle of Kurukshetra by Lord Krishna
and Yudhishthira was ruling
Yudhishthira was very very kind
and respectful
and compassionate
and very nicely he is taking care of
Dhritarashtra and Gandharva
his uncle and aunt
he was taking care of them in the palace
they were living under the care of Yudhishthira
very nicely
but Vidura actually
thought that
Dhritarashtra is actually
not pursuing self realization
he is just living comfortably in the palace
under the care of Yudhishthira
and wasting his time
in simply maintaining the body
simply for the sake of
living a comfortable life
while time is running out
death is nearing
he had become an old man
Dhritarashtra had become an old man
so Vidura came back to the palace
simply to deliver
Dhritarashtra
because he himself
Vidura himself was self realized
so Vidura came back
and how the
members of
the royal palace
received Vidura is being described here
Vidura was so dear to the members
of the Kaurava family
that his long absence from the palace
is comparable to inactivity
all of them were feeling acute separation
from Vidura
and therefore his return to the palace
was joyful for all
the sixth verse
mumucho prema baashpa
mumucho prema baashpaugham
viraha autkantya kataraha
rajatam arhayam chakre
kratasana parigraham
the meaning of this verse is
due to anxieties and long separation
they all cried out of affection
king Yudhishthira then arranged to offer
sitting accommodations and a reception
for Vidura
the seventh verse
tam bhukta vantam vishrantam
asinam sukham asane
prashrayavanato raja
prahatesham cha shunvatam
the meaning of this seventh verse is
after Vidura ate sumptuously
and took sufficient rest
he was comfortably seated
then king Yudhishthira began to speak to him
and all who were present there listened
since he has come back
they are very eager to hear from him
about his travel
now in the purport
Srila Prabhupada explains
something very important about
the Vedic culture
Srila Prabhupada says
king Yudhishthira was expert in reception also
even in the case of his family members
Vidura was well received by all the family members
by exchange of embraces and obeisances
the younger ones to Vidura
they paid obeisances to Vidura
and the equals they embraced
and out of affection for all those family members
Vidura himself
he embraced the affectionate family members
after that
bathing and arrangements for a sumptuous dinner
were made by Yudhishthira
and then Vidura was given sufficient rest
after finishing his rest
Vidura was offered a comfortable place to sit
and then the king Yudhishthira
began to talk about all happenings
both family and otherwise
that is the proper way to receive a beloved friend
or even an enemy
this is the important point
you should note
Srila Prabhupada says
not only receiving a friend properly
so nicely
or some dear relative
but even an enemy comes home
he should be received the same way
like an affectionate relative
or a dear friend
so Srila Prabhupada says
according to Indian moral codes
that is based on the Vedic culture
Vedic tradition
even an enemy received at home
should be so well received
that he will not feel any fearful situation
an enemy is always afraid of his enemy
but this should not be so
when he is received at home
by his enemy
this means that
a person when received at home
should be treated as a relative
so what to speak of a family member like Vidura
was a well wisher for all the members of the family
thus Yudhishthira Maharaj began to speak
in the presence of all the other members
very lovingly
Yudhishthira began to speak to Vidura
now Srila Prabhupada explains elsewhere
what is this
Vedic culture of receiving
a guest
even if the guest
guest means
somebody who comes
without being invited
not having an invitation
obviously enemy will not have an invitation
so even if an enemy comes
or anybody comes without invitation
they are received very nicely
by being offered a reception that is
supposed to be offered to atithi
a guest who is uninvited
who comes home
how should a
householder receive such a guest
so the injunction in the Vedas is
that a householder
should not be a stranger
not a stranger
so whatever a person is
even if a stranger enters your house
you will receive him
in such a friendly way
that he will forget that you are his enemy
and he will have no fear
no fear
of facing the enemy that is the way to receive so Shrila Prabhupada explains elsewhere that
when Parikshit Maharaj went hunting on some occasion and he became very thirsty and he started
looking for water he could not find any body of water nearby in the forest and he happened to come
across the ashram of one Shamika Rishi so he entered that ashram of Shamika Rishi and the
Rishi was sitting there and Yudhishthira Maharaj was not properly welcomed and received by this
Rishi so I'm sorry Parikshit Maharaj was not received properly by Rishis Shamika
so Parikshit Maharaj became very angry but not being received properly so Shrila Prabhupada
explains why did Parikshit Maharaj became become angry at this Shamika Rishi actually Parikshit
Maharaj's Kshatriya is in a subordinate position to Shamika Rishi because Shamika Rishi is a Brahmana
so it is not expected that a Brahmana should
actually respect a Kshatriya in the normal circumstances but in this particular case
when Parikshit Maharaj has come to the ashram as a guest atithi then even if that atithi happens
to be an enemy what to speak of a good Kshatriya king the host the the the the
resident
of that ashram should receive the guest respectfully very nicely very properly
so only because of this particular injection in the scriptures it was justified that Parikshit
Maharaj became upset with Shamika Rishi but then again Shamika Rishi did not was not receiving
परिक्षेत महाराज विकास शमिकर रिशी वास इन एंड मेडिटेशन सो इस एक्स्टाउर्नरी सरकुमस्टेंस अरेंड वाड़
सुप्रीन वॉल्ड सुगर परिक्षेत वुद्धि कर्स वाई द कि संख आफ शमिकर रिशी एंड परिक्षेत शुद्धी टाइप
his kingdom and later on bhagat would be spoken by shukadeva swan pariksit maharaj and will reveal to
the whole world through the medium of shukadeva and pariksit that was krishna's arrangement in any case
this is what prabhupada says the very culture is to receive any uninvited guest properly even if
the guest happens to be none so i'll stop here thank you very much
